sections.title: Dental crowns in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Protective restorations that cover and strengthen a weakened tooth, designed with digital scans and calm, clinician-led appointments.
bullets: Used when a tooth needs reinforcement beyond a filling
Designed to preserve healthy structure wherever possible
Digital scans guide shape, contacts, and bite
Comfort measures for anxious or sensitive patients

sections.title: Protection for teeth that need full coverage
items: Cracks, large fractures, or missing cusps that risk further breakage
Teeth with extensive existing fillings where a replacement would not hold
Teeth restored after root canal treatment that benefit from reinforcement
Heavy wear or erosion where coverage supports bite stability
Situations where contact points and gum health need a carefully sealed margin

sections.title: Strength and coverage when a tooth needs more than a filling
sections.body: A crown replaces the outer surface of a tooth to restore strength, shape, and protection. We assess the remaining structure, gum health, and your bite before recommending a crown, ensuring healthy enamel is preserved wherever safe to do so.
bullets: Assessment of cracks, decay, and remaining tooth structure
Discussion of alternatives such as repair, onlay, or monitoring
Shade and material planning to suit neighbouring teeth
Occlusion and contact design to protect adjacent teeth
Clear timelines for any temporary coverage and final fit

sections.title: Choosing the right level of coverage
items: Filling: suitable for small to medium repairs when enough healthy tooth remains
Onlay: reinforces one or more cusps while preserving more natural enamel
Crown: full-coverage protection when remaining tooth is weakened or heavily restored
We aim for the most conservative option that will last and keep the tooth stable
If an onlay or filling is safer, we will plan that before considering a crown

sections.eyebrow: How we plan and fit your crown
sections.title: Precision steps for a secure, comfortable result
items: Exam, digital scan, and photographs to map shape and bite
Conservative preparation focused on protecting remaining enamel
Temporary cover if needed while the lab crafts your crown
Lab design for shade, contacts, and occlusion based on your scan
Fit appointment with careful seating, margin checks, and bite balancing
Review and maintenance plan to keep the crown and surrounding tooth healthy

sections.label: Digital planning
sections.title: Scans that guide fit, bite, and appearance
sections.body: Intraoral scans capture your bite and neighbouring teeth so the lab can produce a crown with clean margins, comfortable contacts, and a shade that blends. This reduces chairside adjustments and helps the crown feel natural from the first fit.

sections.title: Appointments designed for calm, clear communication
items: Local anaesthetic options explained before any preparation
Gentle isolation and support for patients with gag reflex or anxiety
Temporary coverage smoothed for comfort while the final crown is made
Regular bite checks during fitting to avoid high spots
Clear aftercare guidance and easy contact if anything feels unfamiliar

sections.title: Keeping your crown and tooth healthy
items: Daily cleaning around the margins to protect gums and prevent decay
Avoid biting very hard foods while you adjust to the new crown
Return for bite refinements if you notice sensitivity or heaviness
Hygiene and review visits to monitor the crown and neighbouring teeth
Advice on night-time protection if grinding or clenching is present

sections.title: What to expect from crown treatment

faqs.question: Does getting a crown hurt?
faqs.answer: The tooth is numbed before preparation and fitting. Mild post-appointment sensitivity is possible and usually settles quickly; we review and adjust if anything feels high.

faqs.question: How long will my crown last?
faqs.answer: Lifespan depends on bite forces, cleaning, and material choice. With good hygiene and regular reviews, crowns typically serve for many years; we will outline maintenance tailored to you.

faqs.question: Will the crown match my other teeth?
faqs.answer: We shade-map your neighbouring teeth and use digital scans to guide shape and translucency. The aim is a natural blend that suits your smile and gumline.

faqs.question: Are there alternatives to a crown?
faqs.answer: Where safe, we may recommend monitoring, a repair, or an onlay instead. If coverage is needed to protect the tooth, we will explain why a crown is the stable option.

sections.title: Plan a restorative consultation
sections.body: Book a calm review to understand whether a crown, onlay, or repair is right for your tooth. We will map the digital plan, materials, and maintenance you can expect.
